laboratory_examinations.findings: Pancytopenia with hemoglobin of 5.9 g/dL, white cell count of 2100/µL, and platelets of 76,000/µL. Peripheral blood smear showed ring forms of Plasmodium falciparum and marked thrombocytopenia.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Two weeks post-splenectomy: leukocytes at 14,400/µL, platelets at 666,000/µL, and hemoglobin at 10.0 g/dL. Five weeks post-operatively: leukocytosis (18,700/µL), normal hemoglobin (11.4 g/dL), and thrombocytopenia (28,000/µL).

laboratory_examinations.findings: Gaucher cells, weakly periodic acid Schiff (PAS) positive.
Early skeletal deformities (Erlenmeyer flask deformity) involving the metaphysis of the femur, with no evidence of osteonecrosis.
